up to 200 managed nodes: 8GB RAM, 2 vCPUs
upgrade automate to the latest version
use Chef software in packages or distributions that you create.
use any marks owned by Chef in any way that might state or imply that Chef endorses your distribution;
use any marks owned by Chef in any way that might state or imply that you created the Chef software in question.

used as a drop in replacement for the ring hash load balancer. Maglev is not as stable as ring hash but has faster table lookup build times and host selection times. For more information about Maglev, refer to https://ai.google/research/pubs/pub44824. This field is applicable only when the load_balancing_scheme is set to INTERNAL_MANAGED and the protocol is set to HTTP, HTTPS, or HTTP2.

where <app_name> is the same value as the name of the application in the publish.rb file. When the publish phase is run, an application is created, versioned by timestamp, and including all of the information needed to install that version of the application. The provisioning code in delivery-truck will automatically pin based on this version.

trans-unit.source: where condition defines when a "log_message" and an error_code are sent to the logger and STDERR, after which the chef-client will exit. The error_code itself is arbitrary and is assigned by the individual who writes the code that triggers the fatal message. Assigning an error code is optional, but they can be useful during log file analysis.
trans-unit.target: donde condition define cuándo se "log_message" un "log_message" y un error_code al registrador y STDERR , después de lo cual el chef-cliente saldrá. El error_code en sí es arbitrario y lo asigna la persona que escribe el código que desencadena el mensaje fatal. Asignar un código de error es opcional, pero pueden ser útiles durante el análisis del archivo de registro.

trans-unit.source: where cwd new_resource.cwd, environment new_resource.environment, user new_resource.user, and sensitive new_resource.sensitive correctly use the properties of the execute resource and not the identically-named override properties of the custom resource.
trans-unit.target: donde cwd new_resource.cwd , environment new_resource.environment , user new_resource.user y sensitive new_resource.sensitive utilizan correctamente las propiedades del recurso de ejecución y no las propiedades de anulación con nombres idénticos del recurso personalizado.

trans-unit.source: where data_bag_item makes an HTTP request to the Chef Infra Server to get a data bag item named flowers. If there is a problem, the request will return a Net::HTTPClientException. The rescue block can be used to try to retry or otherwise handle the situation. If the rescue block is unable to handle the situation, then the raise keyword is used to specify the message to be raised.

where data_bag_item makes an HTTP request to the Chef server to get a data bag item named flowers. If there is a problem, the request will return a Net::HTTPServerException. The rescue block can be used to try to retry or otherwise handle the situation. If the rescue block is unable to handle the situation, then the raise keyword is used to specify the message to be raised.
trans-unit.target: donde data_bag_item realiza una solicitud HTTP al servidor Chef para obtener un elemento de bolsa de datos llamado flowers . Si hay un problema, la solicitud devolverá una Net::HTTPServerException . El bloque de rescue se puede usar para intentar volver a intentarlo o manejar la situación. Si el bloque de rescue no puede manejar la situación, la palabra clave raise se usa para especificar el mensaje que se generará.

trans-unit.source: where its('output') { should eq '' } compares the results of the query against the expected result in the test

where job_name represents each of the jobs that are defined in the whitelist and command is the command line that will be run on the target node. The chef-client job is the only job in the whitelist after the initial installation of Chef Push Jobs.

where key is a field name that is found in the JSON description of an indexable object on the Chef Infra Server (a role, node, client, environment, or data bag) and search_pattern defines what will be searched for, using one of the following search patterns: exact, wildcard, range, or fuzzy matching. Both key and search_pattern are case-sensitive; key has limited support for multiple character wildcard matching using an asterisk ("*") (and as long as it is not the first character).

where key is a field name that is found in the JSON description of an indexable object on the Chef server (a role, node, client, environment, or data bag) and search_pattern defines what will be searched for, using one of the following search patterns: exact, wildcard, range, or fuzzy matching. Both key and search_pattern are case-sensitive; key has limited support for multiple character wildcard matching using an asterisk (“*”) (and as long as it is not the first character).
trans-unit.target: donde key es un nombre de campo que se encuentra en la descripción JSON de un objeto indexable en el servidor Chef (un rol, nodo, cliente, entorno o bolsa de datos) y search_pattern define lo que se buscará, utilizando una de las siguientes búsquedas patrones: exacto, comodín, rango o coincidencia difusa. Tanto key como search_pattern distinguen entre mayúsculas y minúsculas; key tiene compatibilidad limitada para la coincidencia de caracteres comodín con un asterisco ("*") (y siempre que no sea el primer carácter).

trans-unit.source: where lazy is used to tell Chef Infra Client to evaluate the contents of the code block later on in the resource evaluation process (instead of immediately) and { code_block } is arbitrary Ruby code that provides the value.

where lazy is used to tell the chef-client to evaluate the contents of the code block later on in the resource evaluation process (instead of immediately) and { code_block } is arbitrary Ruby code that provides the value.
trans-unit.target: donde lazy se usa para indicarle al chef-cliente que evalúe el contenido del bloque de código más adelante en el proceso de evaluación de recursos (en lugar de inmediatamente) y { code_block } es un código Ruby arbitrario que proporciona el valor.

where node['platform'] == 'windows' is the condition set on the return keyword. When the condition is met, stop processing the recipe. This approach is useful when there is no need to continue processing, such as when a package cannot be installed. In this situation, it’s OK for a recipe to stop processing.
trans-unit.target: donde node['platform'] == 'windows' es la condición establecida en la palabra clave de return . Cuando se cumpla la condición, deje de procesar la receta. Este enfoque es útil cuando no hay necesidad de continuar el procesamiento, como cuando no se puede instalar un paquete. En esta situación, está bien que una receta deje de procesarse.

trans-unit.source: where the “[0]” is the 0 (zero) index for the db_server identifier. A single document is returned because the node is being searched on its unique name. The identifier private_ip will now have the value of the private IP address of the database server (10.40.64.202) and can then be used in templates as a variable, among other possible uses.
trans-unit.target: donde "[0]" es el índice 0 (cero) para el identificador db_server . Se devuelve un solo documento porque el nodo se está buscando en su nombre único. El identificador private_ip ahora tendrá el valor de la dirección IP privada del servidor de la base de datos ( 10.40.64.202 ) y luego se puede usar en plantillas como una variable, entre otros posibles usos.

trans-unit.source: where the CertificateThumbprint is the thumbprint hex value copied from the certificate details. (The hex value may require that spaces be removed before passing them to the node using the knife windows plugin.) WinRM 2.0 uses port 5985 for HTTP and port 5986 for HTTPS traffic, by default.

where the branch_name variable is set to staging or master, depending on the environment of the node. Once this is determined, the branch_name variable is used to set the revision for the repository. If the git status command is used after running the example above, it will return the branch name as deploy, as this is the default value. Run the chef-client in debug mode to verify that the correct branches are being checked out:
trans-unit.target: donde la variable branch_name se establece en staging o master , según el entorno del nodo. Una vez que esto se determina, la variable branch_name se usa para establecer la revisión para el repositorio. Si el comando git status se usa después de ejecutar el ejemplo anterior, devolverá el nombre de la rama como deploy , ya que este es el valor predeterminado. Ejecute el chef-cliente en modo de depuración para verificar que las ramas correctas estén siendo extraídas:

where the checksum values must have already been uploaded to the Chef server using the sandbox endpoint. Once a file with a particular checksum has been uploaded by the user, redundant uploads are not necessary. Unused checksum values will be garbage collected.
trans-unit.target: donde los valores de la checksum ya deben haberse cargado en el servidor de Chef utilizando el punto final sandbox. Una vez que el usuario ha subido un archivo con una suma de comprobación particular, no son necesarias las cargas redundantes. Los valores de checksum no utilizados serán basura recolectada.

trans-unit.source: where the command property for the execute resource contains the command that is to be run and the source property for the template resource specifies which template to use. trans-unit.source: where this shows lost communication with the secondary machine and oos: at non-zero (and increasing). This connection state is not fatal, but does represent a degraded state for the cluster where the machines are no longer in sync and are building up a queue of unwritten writes on the originating side that must eventually be synchronized to the secondary machine after the network stabilizes.
trans-unit.target: donde esto muestra pérdida de comunicación con la máquina secundaria y oos: en un valor distinto de cero (y en aumento). Este estado de conexión no es fatal, pero representa un estado degradado para el clúster donde las máquinas ya no están sincronizadas y están acumulando una cola de escrituras no escritas en el lado de origen que finalmente debe sincronizarse con la máquina secundaria después de que la red se estabilice .

why-run mode is a way to see what Chef Infra Client would have configured, had an actual Chef Infra Client run occurred. This approach is similar to the concept of “no-operation” (or “no-op”): decide what should be done, but then don’t actually do anything until it’s done right. This approach to configuration management can help identify where complexity exists in the system, where inter-dependencies may be located, and to verify that everything will be configured in the desired manner.

why-run mode is a way to see what the chef-client would have configured, had an actual chef-client run occurred. This approach is similar to the concept of “no-operation” (or “no-op”): decide what should be done, but then don’t actually do anything until it’s done right. This approach to configuration management can help identify where complexity exists in the system, where inter-dependencies may be located, and to verify that everything will be configured in the desired manner.
trans-unit.target: El modo por qué ejecutar es una forma de ver qué habría configurado el chef-cliente si hubiera ocurrido una ejecución real del chef-cliente. Este enfoque es similar al concepto de "no operación" (o "no-op"): decida qué se debe hacer, pero en realidad no haga nada hasta que se haga correctamente. Este enfoque para la gestión de la configuración puede ayudar a identificar dónde existe complejidad en el sistema, dónde se pueden ubicar las interdependencias y verificar que todo se configure de la manera deseada.

trans-unit.source: why-run mode is not a replacement for running cookbooks in a test environment that mirrors the production environment. Chef uses why-run mode to learn more about what is going on, but also Kitchen on developer systems, along with an internal OpenStack cloud and external cloud providers to test more thoroughly.
trans-unit.target: el modo "por qué correr" no es un sustituto de la ejecución de libros de cocina en un entorno de prueba que refleja el entorno de producción.Chef utiliza el modo "por qué correr" para aprender más sobre lo que está sucediendo,pero también Cocina en los sistemas de desarrollo,junto con una nube interna OpenStack y proveedores de nubes externos para probar más a fondo.

trans-unit.source: will result in a new habitat directory located at /path/to/<reponame>/habitat. A plan file will be created and the pkg_name variable will be set to <reponame>. Also, any environment variables that you have previously set (such as HAB_ORIGIN) will be used to populate the respective pkg_* variables.

would apply the apache2 recipe first, then the apache2::mod_ssl recipe, and then the role[monitor] recipe.
would create a bind aliasing database to the amnesia service in the default service group.

you can use your directory server’s query capabilities to restrict the results to a subtree. The concrete details depend on the product in use; for example in servers supporting extensible match, all group entries below AGroups and BGroups could be retrieved using a group_query_filter of (|(ou:dn:=AGroups)(ou:dn:=BGroups)).

you will get an error because Chef Infra Client will execute get_project_application at compile time before it has run include_recipe 'delivery-truck::provision'. It is recommended to either use get_project_application in deploy.rb, a project cookbook, in a ruby_block or in a separate include_recipe that is executed after include_recipe 'delivery-truck::provision'.

~300GB of raw, unpartitioned disk space is available
trans-unit.target: ~ 300GB de espacio en disco sin particionar está disponible

trans-unit.source: ~50GB of raw, unpartitioned disk space is available. Disk space should scale up with the number of nodes that the backend server is managing. A good rule to follow is to allocate 2 MB per node.
